column3: ut ACK, though it needs rebase\n
Rebased.\n
Any thoughts on the nits and proposed changes to this PR?\n
Along the lines of @jtimon 's comments - a genesis checkpoint does not appear to be needed.\n
@jgarzik I'm actually saying the opposite: the genesis checkpoint that can be trusted (genesis block) is good, but why remove any existing checkpoint in testnet3 ?\n

@jtimon That was covered in the opening PR description?  "allow for older tip blocks"

If we don't want that then sure, keep the checkpoint.

The op says: 

> Remove testnet checkpoint 

why?

> ...and allow for older tip blocks

I want this (like in https://github.com/jtimon/bitcoin/commit/dc1611925dd36f07d1cf3412237610b864a99bcc). jgarzik seems not to want this for some reason.
I have no real opinion.  Just moving things along.\n

Checkpoints beyond the genesis block are a problem because testnet-in-a-box networks won't have those blocks.

MaxTipAge is needed because otherwise mining the first (non-genesis) block is impossible on such a network.

> Checkpoints beyond the genesis block are a problem because
> testnet-in-a-box networks won't have those blocks.

I see. They could also disable checkpoints in their test, but I don't have
a strong opinion: I'm fine removing it if that's the motivation.
What about the rest of my feedback (ie making sure all ghains have a
genesis checkpoint and using hardcoded values as little as possible)?\
@jtimon I don't care about that proposed change, but it's certainly not a bugfix or in the scope of this PR...\n

Instead of removing the checkpoint, users of testnet-in-a-box could specify the option `-checkpoints=0` -  right?

I don't see a simple alternative solution for the tip age, though I still think having it per network is hacky.

+1 on @laanwj 's suggestion to avoid removing testnet3's checkpoint.

@luke-jr I'm just asking to add the genesis checkpoint in main, just like you are adding it to testnet (and already exists on regtest), but if you want to leave that for later (see #6382), that's fine too.
@laanwj If I remove the checkpoint changes here, can we merge the other part with an understanding it will go away when a better solution is found?\n
@luke-jr fine with me\n
@luke-jr ping\n
Sorry for the delay, done.\n
ut ACK\n
utACK\n
Why change this? It only determines whether the client is in initial block download, it shouldn't prevent the client from accepting blocks.\n
IsInitialBlockDownload disables mining.\n
Oh right, that's ugly...\n

would you mind to declare `const CChainParams& chainparams = Params();` at the beginning of the function and use chainparams.MaxTipAge() instead?\nThat will make passing CChainParams as an argument to IsInitialBlockDownload() simpler later.\n

Why remove the checkpoint? why not just add the genesis checkpoint as in https://github.com/jtimon/bitcoin/commit/dc1611925dd36f07d1cf3412237610b864a99bcc ?\nAlso, why not just use consensus.hashGenesisBlock in the genesis checkpoint instead of repeating the hardcoded value?\n

In fact, why not add the genesis checkpoint (the genesis block, the only checkpoint that cannot be reorged) to the mainchain too (and while at it use consensus.hashGenesisBlock for  regtest's gensis checkpoint for uniformity).\n
